snippet.title: Explore a Realistic Recreation of Kyoto in Unreal Engine 4 (free download)
snippet.description:
https://cavesrd.itch.io/kyoto
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1098490/Explore_Fushimi_Inari/
goes by "Explore Fushimi Inari" on steam. also compatible with VR headsets!

stay updated - https://instagr.am/cavesrd
Do you have an idea about how real-time graphics could help your project or business? get in touch - mattcvsrd@gmail.com

Sorry for the wait! I wanted to create a really large map for this one, and I spent some extra time on features like the in-game camera, I hope you'll think it was worth it. I had a blast creating this, really feel like my skills with ue4 have culminated to a point where i'm much more efficient and can create these kinds of environments much easier. hope you all enjoy exploring

I can proudly say all footage in this video is unaltered footage from the engine.
I made this project on my own, using a couple of sources for some game assets, such as quixel megascans, the unreal marketplace, and the book of the dead demo by unity. The majority of japanese themed models I made myself using google's 'blocks' for oculus rift.

music in this video was made by:
quickly quickly
https://open.spotify.com/artist/5XTn5Az9AcSKu0oaauC5ES
https://soundcloud.com/slowlyslowly16/

aso
https://open.spotify.com/artist/45Ui3GdcxzbdJhhTtZLXO8

harris cole
https://open.spotify.com/artist/6DnF6PBcTSsEZuEjXpK0gX
